title: Nestled in a Private, 1,100-Acre Ranch Community: A Modern Masterpiece
text:
Listing of the Day

Location: Steamboat Springs, Colorado

Price: $13.75 million

This 70-acre property with a 10,527-square-foot modern house is one of just 14 home sites in the 1,063-acre Storm Mountain Ranch community, which is in the heart of northwestern Colorado ski country.

Known as Gray Stone Canyon, "this house is on the premier lot in Storm Mountain Ranch," listing agent Pam Vanatta said. "This lot is so special and so private."

"You don’t see another home from this home site," she said.

The private and gated Storm Mountain Ranch is adjacent to the Routt National Forest, Ms. Vanatta said. "It has fisheries and ponds and incredible amenities that the owners have the right to use."

More: Nestled in a Wealthy Denver Suburb, This 1952 French Country-Style House Has a ‘Hollywood-Esque’ Interior

"It’s a playground, basically," she said, with several miles of trails dedicated to cross-country skiing, hiking and biking. "It’s very exclusive and it’s very close to town."

This home, which Ms. Vanatta described as "mountain-modern," was built by the developer in 2004. "It’s beautifully built and it has ponds all around it, with beautiful landscaping."

Design features include large windows and retractable sliding doors for views and bright indoor light, radiant floor heat, oak and Brazilian slate floors, a floating staircase with curved lines, Venetian plaster and wood beam ceiling accents.

The master suite is on the main level and features a steel-accented rock fireplace, vaulted ceilings, Italian marble in the master bath, and dual walk-in closets. It has access to a covered patio with an outdoor shower and views up Walton Creek Canyon.

"The master has some of the best views I’ve ever seen," Ms. Vanatta said.

More: An Art Collector’s Aspen Home Asks $16.9 Million

The kitchen has high-end contemporary cabinetry, top-of-the-line stainless steel appliances and accents, a walk-in pantry, a limestone backsplash, and thick slab granite counters.

The upper level holds two secondary bedroom suites and a large office/project room with built-in desks and cabinetry.

"The outdoor living space in this house is massive," Ms. Vanatta said, with a "screened porch off the living room and a side deck off the master and the family room, with steps to a patio below."

Stats

The 10,527-square-foot house has six bedrooms and seven full bathrooms. It sits on a 70.37-acre lot. There is also a guesthouse with two bedrooms, two full bathrooms and one partial bathroom.

More: Good Snow This Year in Aspen, Colorado, Drives Sales

Amenities

Amenities include a hot tub, fire pit, a large exercise room with a full bath including a steam shower, a full bar, theater room, and a snow-melt system. There are three fireplaces in the main house, plus one in the guesthouse.

There is plenty of covered car parking, including a three-car attached garage, a one-car detached garage, a garage for a recreational vehicle, and a two-car garage attached to the guest house, Ms. Vanatta said.

Ranch amenities include a centrally located common clubhouse and guest cabins.

From Penta: Why Hotels Are Getting Guests Up Close and Personal With Their Favorite Drinks

Neighborhood Notes

The property is about four miles from downtown Steamboat Springs and three miles to the ski area, Steamboat Ski Resort, Ms. Vanatta said.

"The skiing is amazing," she said. "It’s the best Champagne powder—that’s what we call it—in the nation."

"We had 350 inches of snow last year," she added.

Steamboat Springs, which is about three hours from Denver, is a "quaint old ranching community," Ms. Vanatta said. "It’s very tourist driven."

"It’s a great community, a nice place to raise kids," she said.

Agent: Pam Vanatta, Steamboat Sotheby’s International Realty
